Dear Ms. Prudhomme,
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days.
IF CONTRACTED
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant

INVESTIGATION:
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (4) Only the least restrictive intervention necessary to prevent
immediate harm to the youth or others may be used and must follow an
individualized set of graduated interventions that avoid the use of
restraints.
Allegation On 12/17/22, staff member conducted an unwarranted restraint on
youth.
Investigation Interviews:
This information was gained from reviewing restraint reviews by
this Consultant.
Director of Quality was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 4, 2023. Director of Quality reported meeting with Staff 1 to
discuss the hold and provide one-on-one coaching. Director of Quality
stated she discussed when to initiate a proper hold and how to do
things differently with Staff 1.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January 4,
2023. Staff 1 described Youth A using a mop inappropriately and
antagonizing peers during chore time. Staff 1 stated he intervened and
took the mop and mop bucket away from Youth A causing Youth A to
become upset by screaming and swearing. Staff 1 reported Youth B
2

came into the area to talk to Youth A and Youth A pushed Youth B.
Staff 1 stated Youth A pushed past Staff 1 and moved to the office
area, grabbed a holiday wreath, and smashed it. Staff 1 reported Youth
A went to run toward the Christmas tree but before Youth A could get to
the tree Staff 1 restrained Youth A. Staff 1 stated he was concerned
Youth A was going to smash the glass ornaments. Staff 1 stated he
perceived the immediate safety concern was Youth A getting to the
Christmas tree and breaking the glass ornaments creating a safety risk.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on January 4,
2023. Youth A reported he did not want to talk about why he was
restrained by Staff 1. Youth A stated he “kinda feels like he should
have been restrained.” Youth A described Staff 1 preforming the
restraint correctly, not having any injuries and talking with staff after the
restraint.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on January 4,
2023. Youth B stated Youth A was being unsafe so Staff 1 restrained
Youth A. Youth B described Youth A trying to hurt people and push
staff but stated he could not recall the details of exactly what Youth A
was doing to be unsafe. Youth B reported Staff 1 preformed the
restraint correctly.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record and
Staff 1 completed the required Aegis training on 10/31/2022.
• Incident report 146280197 which was consistent with Staff 1’s
interview.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as Staff 1 did not use the least
restrictive intervention with Youth A. Staff 1 stated he perceived the
immediate threat to be Youth A getting to the Christmas tree and
maybe throwing the glass ornaments however there was not an
immediate safety threat at the time Staff 1 restrained Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the that
the current license status be continued.
